Talk29:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Excellent... Thank you for your generous
contribution!
Talk46:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Well done today. A little more practice
and you'll be flying like a pro.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>Here's your reward.
Talk48:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Flying is all about equilibrium.<sp:5:0:0>
To maneuver the wings, start from
<clr:0000>a position with good balance<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Then to steer, try moving around—
<clr:0000>forward, backward, side to side<clr:ffff>.
That should, in theory, do the trick!
Talk49:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What is it?<sp:5:0:0> Did you need something
from Mr. Branli?
Talk10:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>How about it? Feeling flightworthy?<sp:5:0:0> 
Ready to help with my research?
Talk12:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Dear oh dear. <sp:5:1:0>Did you slip and fall off?<sp:5:0:0>
That didn't yield any useful data at all...
No reward for you!
Talk30:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Would you like to have the parameters
explained once again?
Talk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>That was our best flight so far!<sp:5:0:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0801>Here's hoping that you continue to smash
record after record!
Talk31:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_01>Hmm.<sp:5:0:0> I would have expected you to
remember. But very well. It is YOUR life
we're risking, after all...
Mimo!<sp:5:0:0> Refresh the young man's memory!
Talk14:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>How awe-inspiring!<sp:5:0:0> You landed right
inside the circles! A perfect flight!

Which means that my research is
finally complete!

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Mimo!<sp:5:0:0> Give the young man his reward!
He deserves everything we've got!
Talk15:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hmm!<sp:5:0:0> Not quite bird-like, but not bad by
any means either!

<sp:3:0:2:0701>This will give me a good starting point
for my research. <sp:5:0:0>Mimo! Give the young
man his reward!
Talk50:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>*siiigh*<sp:5:1:0> It's raining, and we still aren't
taking a day off.
Talk33:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>That really was a beautiful flight! <sp:5:0:0>You
controlled the wings like they were an
extension of your body.
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Here's your reward.
Talk16:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm.<sp:5:1:0> Well, not every experiment can be a
resounding success. I'm sure I'll find
some use for this data in my research.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>In terms of compensation...<sp:5:1:0>I'd say you
earned a small reward. <sp:5:0:0>Mimo!
Talk51:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'm also curious how this weather may
affect the wings' aerodynamics.
Talk34:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>What are you doing?!<sp:5:0:0> You can't get off
the wings in the middle of the experiment!
<sp:5:0:0>Mimo! <sp:5:0:0>Go pick him up!
Talk17:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Hnng...<sp:5:0:0> What happened? You looked
so confident, and yet failed so badly!
This does nothing for my research!
I'm sorry, but I won't give you a reward
for...that!
Talk35:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm. <sp:5:1:0>You could just sit back and let the
science happen, but no. You want all the
ins and outs picked apart... <sp:5:0:0>Fine.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Mimo, fill the young man in!
Talk18:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>That was impressive. Even we Rito can't
fly that accurately.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>Here's your reward.
Talk36:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>How about it?<sp:5:0:0> Ready to cast off gravity's
cruel bonds and SOAR?
Talk53:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Hey! HEY!<sp:5:0:0> How am I supposed to see you
that far away?

Mimo!<sp:5:0:0> Go pick him up!
Talk19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You know, I could still use more data...<sp:5:0:0>
Another experiment wouldn't hurt!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>How about it? Want to take to the skies
again?
Talk37:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hm! <sp:5:0:0>Exploring a remote island like this...<sp:5:0:0>
Very well.
Talk54:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I said to fly to the <clr:0000>center of the circles<clr:ffff>!<sp:5:1:0>
You've screwed up the entire experiment.<sp:5:0:0>
No reward for you!
Talk38:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Answering a question with a question?
That's pretty rude... But very well.
Near01: You can fly rain or shine!
Talk39:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I am a scholar, presently engaged in
<clr:0000>research on the mechanics of flight<clr:ffff>.

Mimo and I ran into each other when
I was searching for a test site where
I could perform my experiments.
It was he who suggested this island.
Talk56:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We need those wings for our research.
Please leave them where they are.
Talk57:
The rain may limit your visibility
somewhat, but no matter.
Talk58:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>What's happening in that head of yours?
Taking an interest in my work, hm?
Talk00:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Whoa!<sp:5:0:0> A visitor? That's...new. What are
you doing here?
Talk02:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>You know, I could use a test subj—<sp:5:0:0>
Ah, research assistant.
Talk03:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Marvelous! <sp:5:0:0>You won't regret it!


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Now, to be totally candid, we've run into
an unexpected funding shortage...

<sp:3:0:2:0701>So I hate to ask, but would you mind
kicking in, oh, let's say <clr:0000>20 rupees<clr:ffff>?
Talk20:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ah, marvelous!<sp:5:0:0> The more you fly, the
more my research progresses!

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Naturally, I'll need you to provide another
contribution of <clr:0000>20 rupees<clr:ffff>...
Talk04:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm.<sp:5:1:0> So, the miracle of flight doesn't
interest you... <sp:5:0:0>That's fine. Let me know if
you change your mind.
Talk21:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm.<sp:5:0:0> So, you had your taste of flight,
and now you're done?<sp:5:1:0> Fine.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Well, I'll be here, tirelessly working on
my research! <sp:5:0:0>Come back if and when
you're ready to make scientific history!
Talk22:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Is something wrong? <sp:5:0:0>Mr. Branli, I think he
wants to talk to you.
Talk40:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>All right... See the object over there that
looks like <clr:0000>a set of wings<clr:ffff>? <sp:5:0:0>It fell from the
sky recently.
Mr. Branli thinks it may be an ancient
flying device that could be used to <clr:0000>soar
freely through the air<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:0:0>
But at present, that's only an
untested hypothesis.

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>We need you to prove or disprove it
by <clr:0000>getting on the wings <clr:ffff>and <clr:0000>flying <clr:ffff>to
the objective.
Talk06:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hmm.<sp:5:0:0> Seeing as you're new to this
experiment, we had best lay out the
parameters.
Mimo!<sp:5:0:0> Tell the young man what he'll
be doing!
Talk23:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Since the experiment already began,
I can't give back the <clr:0000>20 rupees<clr:ffff> you
gave me. Is that OK?
Talk41:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_00>Mr. Branli told me he dreamt of flying
without wings. It was all so intriguing,
I had to get involved.
Talk07:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Angry_00>Hrrng!<sp:5:0:0> You don't have enough!


<sp:3:0:2:0701>PLEASE save up and come back!
Talk24: <sp:3:0:2:0700>All right, then!<sp:5:0:0> Get back out there!
Talk42:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Now that you're <clr:0000>on the wings<clr:ffff>, it's nearly
time to <clr:0000>take flight<clr:ffff>.
Talk08:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:QuestionNormal_00>What?!<sp:5:0:0> What's so important you had to
stop the experiment?<sp:5:1:0> Please don't tell me
you're backing out.
Talk25:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_01>If you have second thoughts about your
second thoughts, we'll be here.
Talk09:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hello, young man!<sp:5:0:0> My <clr:0000>flight research <clr:ffff>is
progressing by the day. Lots of interesting
insights and learnings, yes indeed.
Is that why you're here? You want to
assist me?
Talk43:
We are asking you to aim for the <clr:0000>center
of the circles <clr:ffff>over there. <sp:5:0:0><clr:0000>Land as close
to the target as you can.<clr:ffff>
Maneuvering with the wings may be
difficult, but we believe you can steer
by maintaining good balance.
<snd:Think_00>Note that <clr:0000>you may not get off the wings<clr:ffff>
until the experiment is complete, as that
would render the data useless.
The closer you get to the goal, the better
data we'll be able to yield, and the more
we'll compensate you for your help!
Talk26:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>WONDERFUL! <sp:5:0:0>You looked like a bird
soaring through the heavens!

This will push my research forward by
leaps and bounds!

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Mimo!<sp:5:0:0> Give the young man his reward!
And make it big!
Talk28:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_01>Ugh!<sp:5:0:0> Don't you care AT ALL about
supporting science?!

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Researchers have to eat, you know!
If you don't contribute, then you don't
get to fly.
Talk45:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>That's a bold way to talk to your only
employee...<sp:5:1:0>
